Detailed Description

This file defines functions relates to PTS_T, LOC_T, MAP_T, etc.

int* loc_create_embed ( int *  nembed,
const LOC_T *  loc 
)

Create an vector to embed OPD into square array for FFT purpose. 

00141                                                     {
00142     double xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,tmp;
00143     maxmindbl(loc->locx, loc->nloc, &xmax, &xmin,&tmp);
00144     maxmindbl(loc->locy, loc->nloc, &ymax, &ymin,&tmp);
00145     const double dx_in1=1./loc->dx;
00146     int nx=(int)round((xmax-xmin)*dx_in1)+1;
00147     int ny=(int)round((ymax-ymin)*dx_in1)+1;
00148     int nxy=(nx>ny?nx:ny)*2;//minimum size
00149     int mapn;
00150     if(*nembed<=0){
00151     mapn=(int)exp2(ceil(log2(nxy)));
00152     *nembed=mapn;
00153     }else{
00154     if(*nembed<nxy){
00155         error("Supplied nembed %d is not valid, need at least %d\n",*nembed,nxy);
00156     }
00157     mapn=*nembed;
00158     }
00159     info2("Science PSF is using grid size of %d\n",mapn);
00160     xmin-=(mapn-nx)/2*loc->dx;
00161     ymin-=(mapn-ny)/2*loc->dx;
00162     int *embed=calloc(loc->nloc, sizeof(int));
00163     
00164     for(int iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
00165     int ix=(int)round((loc->locx[iloc]-xmin)*dx_in1);
00166     int iy=(int)round((loc->locy[iloc]-ymin)*dx_in1);
00167     embed[iloc]=ix+iy*mapn;
00168     }
00169     return embed;
00170 }

void loc_create_map_npad ( LOC_T *  loc,
int  npad 
)

Create a map for loc so that we can obtain the index in loc by x,y coordinate.

Useful in ray tracing (accphi.c) 

00182                                               {
00183     LOCK(maplock);
00184     if(loc->map){
00185     if(loc->map->loc==loc)//already have a map that is valid.
00186         if(loc->map->nloc!=loc->nloc ||loc->map->npad<npad){
00187         loc_free_map(loc);
00188         }else{
00189         UNLOCK(maplock);
00190         return;
00191         }
00192     else
00193         loc->map=NULL;
00194     }
00195     loc->map = calloc(1,sizeof(LOCMAP_T));
00196     loc->map->loc = loc;
00197     loc->map->nloc= loc->nloc;
00198     loc->map->npad = npad;//just record the information.
00199     double xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,tmp;
00200     maxmindbl(loc->locx, loc->nloc, &xmax, &xmin,&tmp);
00201     maxmindbl(loc->locy, loc->nloc, &ymax, &ymin,&tmp);
00202     int map_nx, map_ny;
00203     //padding the map. normally don't need.
00204     if(npad>0){
00205     xmin-=npad*loc->dx;
00206     ymin-=npad*loc->dx;
00207     xmax+=npad*loc->dx;
00208     ymax+=npad*loc->dx;
00209     }
00210     const double dx_in1=1./loc->dx;
00211     map_nx=(int) ceil((xmax-xmin)*dx_in1)+1;
00212     map_ny=(int) ceil((ymax-ymin)*dx_in1)+1;
00213     loc->map->p=calloc(map_nx*map_ny,sizeof(long));
00214     loc->map->nx=map_nx;
00215     loc->map->ny=map_ny;
00216     loc->map->ox=xmin;
00217     loc->map->oy=ymin;
00218     long (*pmap)[map_nx]=(long(*)[map_nx])loc->map->p;
00219     const double *locx,*locy;
00220     locx=loc->locx;
00221     locy=loc->locy;
00222     int ix,iy;
00223     for(long iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
00224     ix=(int)round((locx[iloc]-xmin)*dx_in1);
00225     iy=(int)round((locy[iloc]-ymin)*dx_in1);
00226     pmap[iy][ix]=iloc+1;//start from 1.
00227     }
00228     UNLOCK(maplock);
00229 }

LOC_T* map2loc ( double  dx,
long  nx,
long  ny,
double  ox,
double  oy,
double *  map 
)

Convert a map to a loc that collects all positive entries. 

00248                                              {
00249     double (*map0)[nx]=(double(*)[nx]) map;
00250     long ix,iy;
00251     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1,sizeof(LOC_T));;
00252     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*nx*ny);
00253     loc->locy=malloc(sizeof(double)*nx*ny);
00254 
00255     long count=0;
00256     for(iy=0; iy<ny; iy++){
00257     for(ix=0; ix<nx; ix++){
00258         if(map0[iy][ix]>0){
00259         loc->locx[count]=ix*dx+ox;
00260         loc->locy[count]=iy*dx+oy;
00261         count++;
00262         }
00263     }
00264     }
00265     loc->locx=realloc(loc->locx, sizeof(double)*count);
00266     loc->locy=realloc(loc->locy, sizeof(double)*count);
00267     loc->nloc=count;
00268     loc->dx=dx;
00269     loc->map=NULL;
00270     return loc;
00271 }

00279     if(map[i]>0){
00280         embed[count]=i;
00281         count++;
00282     }
00283     }
00284     embed=realloc(embed, sizeof(long)*count);
00285     return embed;

LOC_T* mk1dloc_vec ( double *  x,
long  nx 
)

Create 1 dimensional loc with given vector. 

00291                                       {
00292     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00293     loc->nloc=nx;
00294     loc->dx=(x[nx-1]-x[0])/(nx-1);
00295     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*nx);
00296     loc->locy=calloc(sizeof(double),nx);
00297     memcpy(loc->locx, x, sizeof(double)*nx);
00298     return loc;
00299 }

LOC_T* mk1dloc ( double  x0,
double  dx,
long  nx 
)

Create 1 dimensional loc with origin at x0, sampling of dx, and nx numbers. 

00303                                              {
00304     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00305     loc->nloc=nx;
00306     loc->dx=dx;
00307     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*nx);
00308     loc->locy=calloc(sizeof(double),nx);//initialize to zero.
00309     for(long ix=0; ix<nx; ix++){
00310     loc->locx[ix]=x0+dx*ix;

00312     return loc;
00313 }

LOC_T* mksqloc ( long  nx,
long  ny,
double  dx,
double  ox,
double  oy 
)

Create a loc array contains coorindates in a square map of size nx*ny, with sampling dx, and at origin ox,oy. 

00330                                                                  {
00331     
00332     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00333     loc->nloc=nx*ny;
00334     loc->dx=dx;
00335     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*loc->nloc);
00336     loc->locy=malloc(sizeof(double)*loc->nloc);
00337     long ix,iy;
00338     double (*locx)[nx]=(double(*)[nx])loc->locx;
00339     double (*locy)[nx]=(double(*)[nx])loc->locy;
00340     double y;
00341     for(iy=0; iy<ny; iy++){
00342     y=iy*dx+oy;
00343     for(ix=0; ix<nx; ix++){
00344         locx[iy][ix]=ix*dx+ox;
00345         locy[iy][ix]=y;
00346     }
00347     }
00348     return loc;
00349 }

LOC_T* mksqlocrot ( long  nx,
long  ny,
double  dx,
double  ox,
double  oy,
double  theta 
)

like mksqloc, but roated theta CCW.

Useful in creating the pixel coordinates in a polar coordinate CCD. 

00354                                                                                   {
00355     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00356     loc->nloc=nx*ny;
00357     loc->dx=dx;
00358     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*loc->nloc);
00359     loc->locy=malloc(sizeof(double)*loc->nloc);
00360     long ix,iy;
00361     double (*locx)[nx]=(double(*)[nx])loc->locx;
00362     double (*locy)[nx]=(double(*)[nx])loc->locy;
00363     double y,x;
00364     double ct=cos(theta);
00365     double st=sin(theta);
00366     for(iy=0; iy<ny; iy++){
00367     y=iy*dx+oy;
00368     for(ix=0; ix<nx; ix++){
00369         x=ix*dx+ox;
00370         locx[iy][ix]=ct*x-st*y;
00371         locy[iy][ix]=st*x+ct*y;
00372     }
00373     }
00374     return loc;
00375 }

LOC_T* mkcirloc ( double  dcir,
double  dx 
)

Create rough circular grid, within diameter of dcir.

Not used often. 

00379                                        {
00380     double rmax2,xmax2;
00381     int N,i,j,count;
00382     N=iceil(dcir/dx/2+5)*2;
00383     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00384     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*N*N);
00385     loc->locy=malloc(sizeof(double)*N*N);
00386     rmax2=(dcir/dx/2.+1*1.414);
00387     rmax2*=rmax2;
00388     count=0;
00389    
00390     for(j=-N/2;j<N/2;j++){
00391     xmax2=rmax2-j*j;
00392     /*this method is good. there are no holes*/
00393     for(i=-N/2;i<N/2;i++){
00394         if(i*i<xmax2){
00395         loc->locx[count]=i*dx;
00396         loc->locy[count]=j*dx;
00397         count++;
00398         }
00399     }
00400     }
00401     loc->locx = realloc(loc->locx, sizeof(double)*count);
00402     loc->locy = realloc(loc->locy, sizeof(double)*count);
00403     loc->nloc = count;
00404     loc->dx   = dx;
00405     return loc;
00406 }

LOC_T* mkcirloc_amp ( double **  ampout,
LOCSTAT_T *  cstat,
MAP_T *  ampin,
double  dcir,
double  dx,
int  cropamp 
)

Create LOC map when amplitude map is specified, within a maximum diameter.

The amplitude map must be defined in the same sampling of dx.

  • cropmap=0: LOC is purely defined by the amplitude map. dcir is irrelevant in this case.
  • cropmap=1: LOC is forced to be within dcir. ampin is cropped.

cstat records the starting point for each row to speed up accphi.

Parameters:
[out] ampout amplitude map defined on loc
[out] cstat statistics on loc
[in,out] ampin the amplitude that defines the circular aperture, modified to widhtin dtel if cropmap=1
[in] dcir maximum diameter of the circular loc
[in] dx sampling of output loc
[in] cropamp do we zero ampin points if it outside of dcir 
00424              {
00425     LOC_T *loc=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
00426     double *restrict ampp = ampin->p;
00427     int count,colcount,count0;
00428     double rmax2=(dcir/dx/2.+1*1.414);
00429     rmax2*=rmax2;
00430 
00431     if(ampin->nx*dx<dcir || ampin->ny*dx<dcir){
00432     error("maximum diameter is %g m, amplitude is %g mx%g m, "
00433           "with sampling of 1/%g m\n",dcir,
00434           ampin->nx*dx,ampin->ny*dx,1/dx);
00435     }else if(ampin->nx*dx>2*dcir){
00436     warning("maximum diameter is %g m, amplitude map is %gx%g m, "
00437         "with sampling of 1/%g m\n"
00438         "\t\t\tWill crop the amplitude map to maximum diameter of %g\n",
00439         dcir,ampin->nx*dx,ampin->ny*dx,1/dx,dcir);
00440     }
00441     
00442     loc->locx=malloc(sizeof(double)*ampin->nx*ampin->ny);
00443     loc->locy=malloc(sizeof(double)*ampin->nx*ampin->ny);
00444     *ampout  =malloc(sizeof(double)*ampin->nx*ampin->ny);
00445     count=0;   //count number of points.
00446     colcount=0;//count number of columns (y)
00447 
00448     int ncolstat=ampin->ny+1;
00449     if(cstat){
00450     cstat->cols=calloc(ncolstat, sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T));
00451     }
00452     int offsety=ampin->ny/2;
00453     int offsetx=ampin->nx/2;
00454     /*scan through the input maps*/
00455     for(int iy=0; iy<ampin->ny; iy++){
00456     int jy=iy-offsety;
00457     int imin, imax, iminnotfound;
00458     double xmax2=rmax2-jy*jy;//max limit of x coord
00459     count0=count;//starting number of this column
00460 
00461     imin=INT_MAX;
00462     imax=-INT_MAX;
00463     iminnotfound=1;
00464     int offset2=iy*ampin->nx;
00465     /*we find nonzero min and max index for each column.*/
00466     for(int ix=0; ix<ampin->nx; ix++){
00467         if(ampp[ix+offset2]>0){
00468         if(iminnotfound){
00469             imin=ix;
00470             iminnotfound=0;
00471         }
00472         imax=ix;
00473         }
00474     }
00475     for(int ix=imin;ix<imax+1;ix++){
00476         /*use amp only will create locs with holes it. the method
00477           using stat to do accphi will be in trouble*/
00478         int jx=ix-offsetx;
00479         if(!cropamp || jx*jx<xmax2){
00480         loc->locx[count]=jx*dx;
00481         loc->locy[count]=jy*dx;
00482         (*ampout)[count]=ampp[ix+offset2];
00483         count++;
00484         }else{
00485         ampp[ix+offset2]=0;/*zero out the amplitude map*/
00486         }
00487     }
00488     if(cstat){
00489         if(count>count0){
00490         /*row valid*/
00491         if(colcount>=ncolstat){
00492             ncolstat*=2;
00493             cstat->cols=realloc(cstat->cols, sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T)*ncolstat);
00494         }
00495         (cstat->cols)[colcount].xstart=loc->locx[count0];
00496         (cstat->cols)[colcount].ystart=loc->locy[count0];
00497         (cstat->cols)[colcount].pos=count0;
00498         colcount++;
00499         }
00500     }
00501     }
00502     /*append an addition row which marks the boundary*/
00503     if(cstat){
00504     cstat->cols[colcount].pos=count;/*record last*/
00505     cstat->cols = realloc(cstat->cols, sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T)*(colcount+1));
00506     cstat->ncol = colcount;
00507     cstat->dx   = dx;
00508     }
00509     loc->locx = realloc(loc->locx, sizeof(double)*count);
00510     loc->locy = realloc(loc->locy, sizeof(double)*count);
00511     loc->nloc = count;
00512     loc->dx   = dx;
00513     *ampout=realloc(*ampout, sizeof(double)*count);
00514     return loc;
00515 }

int loccenter ( LOC_T *  loc  ) 

Find the point that closes to origin (0,0) in loc.

Useful in single point piston constraint in creating reconstructor. 

00522                          {
00523     int ipix,jpix=0;
00524     double r2,r2min=INFINITY;
00525     
00526     for(ipix=0; ipix<loc->nloc; ipix++){
00527     r2=pow(loc->locx[ipix],2)+pow(loc->locy[ipix],2);
00528     if(r2<r2min){
00529         jpix=ipix;
00530         r2min=r2;
00531     }
00532     }
00533     return jpix;
00534 }

dmat* loc_mcc_ptt ( const LOC_T *  loc,
const double *  amp 
)

assemble modes of piston/tip/tilt into Nx3 matrix M, and compute their inverse covariance matrix.

mcc=M'*(amp.*M) 

00539                                                       {
00540     const int nmod=3;
00541     double *mod[nmod];
00542     dmat *mcc=dnew(nmod,nmod);
00543     mod[0]=NULL;
00544     mod[1]=loc->locx;
00545     mod[2]=loc->locy;
00546     double (*ATA)[nmod]=(double(*)[nmod])mcc->p;
00547     for(int jmod=0; jmod<nmod; jmod++){
00548     for(int imod=jmod; imod<nmod; imod++){
00549         double tmp=dotdbl(mod[imod],mod[jmod],amp,loc->nloc);
00550         ATA[jmod][imod]=ATA[imod][jmod]=tmp;
00551     }
00552     }
00553     return mcc;
00554 }

dcell* pts_mcc_ptt ( const PTS_T *  pts,
const double *  amp 
)

same as loc_mcc_ptt, except using pts instead of loc.

this is used to build imcc for TT/F powfs ztilt imcc 

00559                                                        {
00560     const int nmod=3;
00561     const int nsa=pts->nsa;
00562     dcell *mcc=dcellnew(nsa,1);
00563     for(int isa=0; isa<nsa; isa++){
00564     const double origy=pts->origy[isa];
00565     const double origx=pts->origx[isa];
00566     const double dx=pts->dx;
00567     const double *ampi=amp+pts->nx*pts->nx*isa;
00568     mcc->p[isa]=dnew(nmod,nmod);
00569     double (*ATA)[nmod]=(double(*)[nmod])(mcc->p[isa]->p);
00570     double a00=0,a01=0,a02=0,a11=0,a12=0,a22=0;
00571     for(int iy=0; iy<pts->nx; iy++){
00572         double y=iy*dx+origy;
00573         const double *ampx=ampi+iy*pts->nx;
00574         for(int ix=0; ix<pts->nx; ix++){
00575         double x=ix*dx+origx;
00576         a00+=ampx[ix];
00577         a01+=ampx[ix]*x;
00578         a02+=ampx[ix]*y;
00579         a11+=ampx[ix]*x*x;
00580         a12+=ampx[ix]*x*y;
00581         a22+=ampx[ix]*y*y;
00582         }
00583     }
00584     ATA[0][0]=a00;
00585     ATA[1][1]=a11;
00586     ATA[2][2]=a22;
00587     ATA[1][0]=ATA[0][1]=a01;
00588     ATA[2][0]=ATA[0][2]=a02;
00589     ATA[2][1]=ATA[1][2]=a12;
00590     }
00591     return mcc;
00592 }

void loc_calc_ptt ( double *  rmsout,
double *  coeffout,
const LOC_T *  loc,
const double  ipcc,
const dmat *  imcc,
const double *  amp,
const double *  opd 
)

evaluate piston/tip-tilt/ removed wavefront error.

output coeffout in unit of radian like units. 

00600                                                                  {
00601     assert(imcc->nx==imcc->ny && imcc->nx==3);
00602     const long nloc=loc->nloc;
00603     const double *restrict locx=loc->locx;
00604     const double *restrict locy=loc->locy;
00605 
00606     double tot=0;
00607     double coeff[3]={0,0,0};
00608     if(amp){
00609     if(rmsout){
00610         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00611         const double junk=opd[iloc]*amp[iloc];
00612         coeff[0]+=junk;
00613         coeff[1]+=junk*locx[iloc];
00614         coeff[2]+=junk*locy[iloc];
00615         tot+=junk*opd[iloc];
00616         }
00617     }else{
00618         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00619         const double junk=opd[iloc]*amp[iloc];
00620         coeff[0]+=junk;
00621         coeff[1]+=junk*locx[iloc];
00622         coeff[2]+=junk*locy[iloc];
00623         //tot+=junk*opd[iloc];
00624         }
00625     }
00626     }else{
00627     if(rmsout){
00628         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00629         const double junk=opd[iloc];
00630         coeff[0]+=junk;
00631         coeff[1]+=junk*locx[iloc];
00632         coeff[2]+=junk*locy[iloc];
00633         tot+=junk*opd[iloc];
00634         }
00635     }else{
00636         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00637         const double junk=opd[iloc];
00638         coeff[0]+=junk;
00639         coeff[1]+=junk*locx[iloc];
00640         coeff[2]+=junk*locy[iloc];
00641         //tot+=junk*opd[iloc];
00642         }
00643     }
00644     }
00645     if(coeffout){
00646     dmulvec3(coeffout, imcc, coeff);
00647     }
00648     if(rmsout){
00649     double pis=ipcc*coeff[0]*coeff[0];
00650     double ptt=dwdot3(coeff, imcc, coeff);
00651     rmsout[0]=tot-pis;//PR
00652     rmsout[1]=ptt-pis;//TT
00653     rmsout[2]=tot-ptt;//PTTR
00654     }
00655 }

void loc_calc_mod ( double *  rmsout,
double *  coeffout,
const dmat *  mod,
const double *  amp,
double *  opd 
)

Calculate variance of OPD in modes defined in mod.

Notice the difference in rmsout for loc_calc_ptt and this loc_calc_mode. in loc_calc_ptt, out[0] is PR, out[1] is TT, out[2] is PTTR in loc_calc_mod, out[0] is PR, out[1] is PTR, out[2] is PTTR, etc

The mod is already orth-noramlized so that we have the following simple forms.

coeffout is in unit of zernike! 

00669                                         {
00670   
00671     const int nmod=mod->ny;
00672     const int nloc=mod->nx;
00673     PDMAT(mod,pmod);
00674  
00675     double tot=0;
00676     double val[nmod];
00677     memset(val, 0, sizeof(double)*nmod);
00678     for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00679     double junk=opd[iloc]*amp[iloc];
00680     tot+=opd[iloc]*junk;
00681     for(long imod=0; imod<nmod; imod++){
00682         val[imod]+=pmod[imod][iloc]*junk;
00683     }
00684     }
00685     for(long imod=0; imod<nmod; imod++){
00686     tot-=val[imod]*val[imod];
00687     rmsout[imod]=tot;
00688     }
00689     if(coeffout){
00690     for(long imod=0; imod<nmod; imod++){
00691         coeffout[imod]=val[imod];
00692     }
00693     }
00694 }

00710                                                                   {

00713     const double *restrict locy=loc->locy;

void pts_ztilt ( double *  out,
const PTS_T *  pts,
const dcell *  imcc,
const double *  amp,
const double *  opd 
)

Compute zernike best fit for all subapertures.

add result to out. returns radians not zernike modes of tip/tilt. Used in wfsgrad 

00722                                                 {
00723     const int nsa=pts->nsa;
00724     assert(imcc->nx==nsa && imcc->ny==1);
00725     double (*res)[nsa]=(double(*)[nsa])out;
00726     for(int isa=0; isa<nsa; isa++){
00727     const double origy=pts->origy[isa];
00728     const double origx=pts->origx[isa];
00729     const double dx=pts->dx;
00730     const double *ampi=amp+pts->nx*pts->nx*isa;
00731     const double *opdi=opd+pts->nx*pts->nx*isa;
00732     assert(imcc->p[isa]->nx==3 && imcc->p[isa]->nx==3);
00733         double coeff[3]={0,0,0};
00734     double a0=0,a1=0,a2=0;
00735     for(int iy=0; iy<pts->nx; iy++){
00736         double y=iy*dx+origy;
00737         const double *ampx=ampi+iy*pts->nx;
00738         const double *opdx=opdi+iy*pts->nx;
00739         for(int ix=0; ix<pts->nx; ix++){
00740         double x=ix*dx+origx;
00741         double tmp=ampx[ix]*opdx[ix];
00742         a0+=tmp;
00743         a1+=tmp*x;
00744         a2+=tmp*y;
00745         }
00746     }
00747     coeff[0]=a0;
00748     coeff[1]=a1;
00749     coeff[2]=a2;
00750     double outp[3];
00751     dmulvec3(outp, imcc->p[isa], coeff);
00752     /*
00753       2010-07-19: Was =, modified to += to conform to the convention.
00754      */
00755     res[0][isa]+=outp[1];
00756     res[1][isa]+=outp[2];
00757     }
00758 }

LOCSTAT_T* mklocstat ( const LOC_T *  loc  ) 

Gather information about the starting of each column in loc. 

00762                                       {
00763     LOCSTAT_T *locstat=calloc(1, sizeof(LOCSTAT_T));
00764     const double *locx=loc->locx;
00765     const double *locy=loc->locy;
00766     int nloc=loc->nloc;
00767     double dx=locstat->dx=loc->dx;
00768     int ncolmax=(int)round((locy[nloc-1]-locy[0])/dx)+2;
00769     locstat->cols=malloc(ncolmax*sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T));
00770     int colcount=0;
00771     int iloc=0;
00772     locstat->cols[colcount].pos=iloc;
00773     locstat->cols[colcount].xstart=locx[iloc];
00774     locstat->cols[colcount].ystart=locy[iloc];
00775     colcount++;
00776     for(iloc=1; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
00777     if(fabs(locy[iloc]-locy[iloc-1])>1.e-12 
00778        || fabs(locx[iloc]-locx[iloc-1]-dx)>1.e-12){
00779         if(colcount>=ncolmax){
00780         ncolmax*=2;
00781         locstat->cols=realloc(locstat->cols, ncolmax*sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T));
00782         }
00783         locstat->cols[colcount].pos=iloc;
00784         locstat->cols[colcount].xstart=locx[iloc];
00785         locstat->cols[colcount].ystart=locy[iloc];      
00786         colcount++;
00787     }
00788     }
00789     locstat->ncol=colcount;
00790     locstat->cols[colcount].pos=loc->nloc;
00791     locstat->cols[colcount].xstart=locx[loc->nloc-1];
00792     locstat->cols[colcount].ystart=locy[loc->nloc-1];
00793     locstat->cols=realloc(locstat->cols,(locstat->ncol+1)*sizeof(LOCSTATCOL_T));
00794     return locstat;
00795 }

void loccircle ( double *  phi,
LOC_T *  loc,
double  cx,
double  cy,
double  r,
double  val 
)

Create a gray pixel circular map in phi using coordinates defined in loc, center defined using cx, cy, radius of r, and value of val. 

00799                                                                               {
00800     //cx,cy,r are in unit of true unit, as in loc
00801     double dx=loc->dx;
00802     int nres=10;
00803     double cres=(nres-1.)/2.;
00804     double res=1./nres;
00805     double dxres=res*dx;
00806     double res2=res*res;
00807     double r2=r*r;
00808     double r2l=(r-dx*1.5)*(r-dx*1.5);
00809     double r2u=(r+dx*1.5)*(r+dx*1.5);
00810     double *locx=loc->locx;
00811     double *locy=loc->locy;
00812     double iix,iiy;
00813     for(int iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
00814     double x=locx[iloc];
00815     double y=locy[iloc];
00816     double r2r=pow(x-cx,2)+pow(y-cy,2);
00817     if(r2r<r2l) 
00818         phi[iloc]+=val;
00819     else if(r2r<r2u){
00820         long tot=0;
00821         for(int jres=0; jres<10; jres++){
00822         iiy=y+(jres-cres)*dxres;
00823         double rr2y=(iiy-cy)*(iiy-cy);
00824         for(int ires=0; ires<nres; ires++){
00825             iix=x+(ires-cres)*dxres;
00826             double rr2r=(iix-cx)*(iix-cx)+rr2y;
00827             if(rr2r<r2)
00828             tot++;
00829         }
00830         }
00831         phi[iloc]+=tot*res2*val;
00832     }
00833     }
00834 }

void locellipse ( double *  phi,
LOC_T *  loc,
double  cx,
double  cy,
double  rx,
double  ry,
double  val 
)

Create a gray pixel elliptical map in phi using coordinates defined in loc, center defined using cx, cy, radii of rx, ry, and value of val. 

00839                                        {
00840     //cx,cy,r are in unit of true unit, as in loc
00841     double dx=loc->dx;
00842     int nres=10;
00843     double cres=(nres-1.)/2.;
00844     double res=1./nres;
00845     double dxres=res*dx;
00846     double res2=res*res;
00847     double rx1=1./rx;
00848     double ry1=1./ry;
00849     double rx12=rx1*rx1;
00850     double ry12=ry1*ry1;
00851     double r2=2.;
00852     double r2l=(rx-dx)*(rx-dx)*rx12+(ry-dx)*(ry-dx)*ry12;
00853     double r2u=(rx+dx)*(rx+dx)*rx12+(ry+dx)*(ry+dx)*ry12;
00854     double *locx=loc->locx;
00855     double *locy=loc->locy;
00856     double iix,iiy;
00857     for(int iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
00858     double x=locx[iloc];
00859     double y=locy[iloc];
00860     double r2r=pow(x-cx,2)*rx12+pow(y-cy,2)*ry12;
00861     if(r2r<r2l) 
00862         phi[iloc]+=val;
00863     else if(r2r<r2u){
00864         long tot=0;
00865         for(int jres=0; jres<nres; jres++){
00866         iiy=y+(jres-cres)*dxres;
00867         double rr2y=(iiy-cy)*(iiy-cy)*ry12;
00868         for(int ires=0; ires<nres; ires++){
00869             iix=x+(ires-cres)*dxres;
00870             double rr2r=(iix-cx)*(iix-cx)*rx12+rr2y;
00871             if(rr2r<r2)
00872             tot++;
00873         }
00874         }
00875         phi[iloc]+=tot*res2*val;
00876     }
00877     }
00878 }

void loc_reduce_spcell ( LOC_T *  loc,
spcell *  spc,
int  dim,
int  cont 
)

Remove uncoupled points in loc.

debugged on 2009-12-20. Not used often. using a spcell, to compute the coupling which is modified accordingly. 

00883                                                                   {
00884     int nloc=loc->nloc;
00885     int32_t *skip=calloc(nloc,sizeof(int32_t));
00886     dmat *sum=NULL;
00887     for(int isp=0; isp<spc->nx*spc->ny; isp++){
00888     if(spc->p[isp]){
00889         dmat* sum0=spsumabs(spc->p[isp],3-dim);
00890         dadd(&sum,1,sum0,1);
00891         dfree(sum0);
00892     }
00893     }
00894     if(!sum || sum->nx*sum->ny!=loc->nloc){
00895     error("Mismatch\n");
00896     }
00897     if(cont){//make sure loc is continuous.
00898     LOCSTAT_T *locstat=mklocstat(loc);
00899     int ncol=locstat->ncol;
00900     for(int icol=0; icol<ncol; icol++){
00901         int pstart=locstat->cols[icol].pos;
00902         int pend=locstat->cols[icol+1].pos;
00903         for(int pos=pstart; pos<pend; pos++){
00904         if(sum->p[pos]<1.e-200){
00905             skip[pos]=1;
00906         }else{
00907             break;
00908         }
00909         }
00910         for(int pos=pend-1; pos>pstart-1; pos--){
00911         if(sum->p[pos]<1.e-200){
00912             skip[pos]=1;
00913         }else{
00914             break;
00915         }
00916         }
00917     }
00918     locstatfree(locstat);
00919     }else{
00920     for(int iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00921         if(sum->p[iloc]<1.e-200){
00922         skip[iloc]=1;
00923         }
00924     }
00925     }
00926     //writeint32(skip,nloc,1,"skip");
00927     int count=0;
00928     for(int iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00929     loc->locx[count]=loc->locx[iloc];
00930     loc->locy[count]=loc->locy[iloc];
00931     if(!skip[iloc]) count++;
00932     }
00933     loc->locx=realloc(loc->locx,sizeof(double)*count);
00934     loc->locy=realloc(loc->locy,sizeof(double)*count);
00935     loc->nloc=count;
00936     if(dim==1){//opd(loc)=sp*opd(locin);
00937     count=0;
00938     int *map=calloc(nloc,sizeof(int));
00939     for(int iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00940         map[iloc]=count;
00941         if(!skip[iloc]) count++;
00942     }
00943     for(int isp=0; isp<spc->nx*spc->ny;isp++){
00944         dsp *sp=spc->p[isp];
00945         if(!sp) continue;
00946         sp->m=count;
00947         for(int iz=0; iz<sp->nzmax; iz++){
00948         sp->i[iz]=map[sp->i[iz]];
00949         }
00950     }
00951     free(map);
00952     }else if(dim==2){
00953     for(int isp=0; isp<spc->nx*spc->ny;isp++){
00954         dsp *sp=spc->p[isp];
00955         if(!sp) continue;
00956         count=0;
00957         for(int iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
00958         if(!skip[iloc]){
00959             sp->p[count]=sp->p[iloc];
00960             count++;
00961         }
00962         }
00963         sp->p[count]=sp->p[nloc];
00964         sp->n=count;
00965         sp->p=realloc(sp->p,sizeof(long)*(count+1));
00966     }
00967     }
00968     free(skip);
00969     dfree(sum);
00970 }

01031     }
01032     free(map);
01033     }else if(dim==2){
01034     count=0;
01035     for(int iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01036         if(!skip[iloc]){
01037         sp->p[count]=sp->p[iloc];
01038         count++;
01039         }
01040     }
01041     sp->p[count]=sp->p[nloc];
01042     sp->n=count;
01043     sp->p=realloc(sp->p,sizeof(long)*(count+1));
01044     }
01045     free(skip);
01046     dfree(sum);
01047 }

static dmat* genRnm ( dmat *  locr,
int  ir,
int  im 
) [static]

Generating Zernike Rnm for radial order ir, azimuthal or im.

used by loc_zernike. 

01052                                                {
01053     if(ir<0 || im < 0|| im>ir || (ir-im)%2!=0)
01054     error("Invalid ir, im (%d, %d)\n", ir, im);
01055     
01056     const long nloc=locr->nx;
01057     dmat *Rnm=dnew(nloc,1);
01058     for(int s=0; s<=(ir-im)/2; s++){
01059     double coeff=pow(-1,s)*(double)factorial(ir-s)
01060         /(double)(factorial(s)*factorial((ir+im)/2-s)*factorial((ir-im)/2-s));
01061     int power=ir-2*s;
01062     if(power==0){
01063         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01064         Rnm->p[iloc]+=coeff;
01065         }
01066     }else if(power==1){
01067         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01068         Rnm->p[iloc]+=coeff*locr->p[iloc];
01069         }
01070     }else{
01071         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01072         Rnm->p[iloc]+=coeff*pow(locr->p[iloc],power);
01073         }
01074     }
01075     }
01076     return Rnm;
01077 }

dmat* loc_zernike ( LOC_T *  loc,
double  R,
int  nr 
)

Create Zernike modes on loc with radius R and radial order upto nr nr=0 is piston nr=1 is tip/tilt nr=2 is quadratic modes. 

01086                                                {
01087     if(nr<0) error("Invalid nr\n");
01088     int nmod=(nr+1)*(nr+2)/2;
01089     const long nloc=loc->nloc;
01090     dmat *restrict MOD=dnew(nloc,nmod);
01091     
01092     dmat *restrict locr=dnew(nloc,1);
01093     dmat *restrict locs=dnew(nloc,1);
01094     const double *restrict locx=loc->locx;
01095     const double *restrict locy=loc->locy;
01096     const double R1=1./R;
01097     for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01098     locr->p[iloc]=sqrt(pow(locx[iloc],2)+pow(locy[iloc],2))*R1;
01099     locs->p[iloc]=atan2(locy[iloc], locx[iloc]);
01100     }
01101     int cmod=0;
01102     for(int ir=0; ir<=nr; ir++){
01103     for(int im=0; im<=ir; im++){
01104         if((ir-im)%2!=0) continue;
01105         dmat *Rnm=genRnm(locr, ir, im);
01106         //dwrite(Rnm,"Rnm_%d_%d",ir,im);
01107         if(im==0){
01108         double coeff=sqrt(ir+1.);
01109         double *restrict pmod=MOD->p+nloc*cmod;
01110         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01111             pmod[iloc]=Rnm->p[iloc]*coeff;
01112         }
01113         cmod++;
01114         }else{
01115         double coeff=sqrt(2*(ir+1.));
01116         double *restrict pmodc;
01117         double *restrict pmods;
01118         if((cmod+1) % 2 == 1){
01119             pmods=MOD->p+nloc*cmod;
01120             pmodc=MOD->p+nloc*(cmod+1);
01121         }else{
01122             pmodc=MOD->p+nloc*cmod;
01123             pmods=MOD->p+nloc*(cmod+1);
01124         }
01125         for(long iloc=0; iloc<nloc; iloc++){
01126             pmods[iloc]=Rnm->p[iloc]*coeff*sin(im*locs->p[iloc]);
01127             pmodc[iloc]=Rnm->p[iloc]*coeff*cos(im*locs->p[iloc]);
01128         }
01129         cmod+=2;
01130         }
01131         dfree(Rnm);
01132     }
01133     }
01134     dfree(locr);
01135     dfree(locs);
01136     return MOD;
01137 }

void loc_add_focus ( double *  opd,
LOC_T *  loc,
double  val 
)

Add val amount of focus to opd.

The unit is in radian like. Piston is not removed. 

01143                                                        {
01144     if(fabs(val)<1.e-15) return;

01146     const double *restrict locy=loc->locy;
01147     for(long iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
01148     opd[iloc]+=(locx[iloc]*locx[iloc]+locy[iloc]*locy[iloc])*val;

01154                                     {

LOC_T* pts2loc ( PTS_T *  pts  ) 

Convert PTS_T to LOC_T.

Each entry in pts recors the lower left point in each subaperture. 

01176                           {
01177     LOC_T*loc = calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
01178     long nsa  = pts->nsa;
01179     long nx   = pts->nx;
01180     long nxsa = nx*nx;
01181     loc->locx = malloc(sizeof(double)*nsa*nxsa);
01182     loc->locy = malloc(sizeof(double)*nsa*nxsa);
01183     loc->nloc = nsa*nxsa;
01184     double dx = loc->dx = pts->dx;
01185     for(int isa=0; isa<nsa; isa++){
01186     const double origx = pts->origx[isa];
01187     const double origy = pts->origy[isa];
01188     double *locx = loc->locx+isa*nxsa;
01189     double *locy = loc->locy+isa*nxsa;
01190     for(int jj=0; jj<nx; jj++){
01191         const double yy=origy+(double)jj*dx;
01192         for(int ii=0; ii<nx; ii++){
01193         locx[jj*nx+ii]=origx+(double)ii*dx;
01194         locy[jj*nx+ii]=yy;
01195         }
01196     }
01197     }
01198     return loc;
01199 }

void locrot ( LOC_T *  loc,
const double  theta 
)

Rotate the coordinates by theta CCW. 

01204                                            {
01205     const double ctheta=cos(theta);
01206     const double stheta=sin(theta);
01207 
01208     double *x=loc->locx;
01209     double *y=loc->locy;
01210     for(int i=0; i<loc->nloc; i++){
01211     double tmp=x[i]*ctheta-y[i]*stheta;
01212     y[i]=x[i]*stheta+y[i]*ctheta;
01213     x[i]=tmp;
01214     }
01215 }

LOC_T* loctransform ( LOC_T *  loc,
dmat **  coeff 
)

Transform coordinate.

loc contains x,y; locm contains xm, ym. xm{ip}=sum}_{ic}(coeff[0](1,ic)*pow(x,coeff[0](2,ic))*pow(y,coeff[0](3,ic))) ym{ip}=sum}_{ic}(coeff[1](1,ic)*pow(x,coeff[1](2,ic))*pow(y,coeff[1](3,ic))) 

01235                                              {
01236 
01237     if(coeff[0]->nx!=3 || coeff[1]->nx!=3){
01238     error("Coeff is in wrong format\n");
01239     }
01240     PDMAT(coeff[0],cx);
01241     PDMAT(coeff[1],cy);
01242 
01243     LOC_T *locm=calloc(1, sizeof(LOC_T));
01244     locm->nloc=loc->nloc;
01245     locm->dx=loc->dx;
01246     locm->locx=calloc(locm->nloc, sizeof(double));
01247     locm->locy=calloc(locm->nloc, sizeof(double));
01248     const double *restrict x=loc->locx;
01249     const double *restrict y=loc->locy;
01250     double *restrict xm=locm->locx;
01251     double *restrict ym=locm->locy;
01252 
01253     for(long iloc=0; iloc<loc->nloc; iloc++){
01254     for(long ic=0; ic<coeff[0]->ny; ic++){
01255         xm[iloc]+=cx[ic][0]*pow(x[iloc],cx[ic][1])*pow(y[iloc],cx[ic][2]);
01256     }
01257     for(long ic=0; ic<coeff[1]->ny; ic++){
01258         ym[iloc]+=cy[ic][0]*pow(x[iloc],cy[ic][1])*pow(y[iloc],cy[ic][2]);
01259     }
01260     }
01261     return locm;
01262 }

void loc_nxny ( long *  nx,
long *  ny,
const LOC_T *  loc 
)

Compute the size of a map that is used to build loc or can fully contain loc (embed). 

01268                                                    {
01269     double xmax, xmin, ymax, ymin;
01270     maxmindbl(loc->locx, loc->nloc, &xmax, &xmin, NULL);
01271     maxmindbl(loc->locy, loc->nloc, &ymax, &ymin, NULL);
01272     *nx=(long)round((xmax-xmin)/loc->dx)+1;
01273     *ny=(long)round((ymax-ymin)/loc->dx)+1;
01274 }
